extendedIngredients.name: orange zest
extendedIngredients.original: Also, zest the orange and put in a small bowl. Slice the orange in half and tablespoon the juice in another bowl.

extendedIngredients.original: Chop the zucchini, half the tomatoes, chop the onion and mince the garlic.

extendedIngredients.name: first
extendedIngredients.original: First, salt and pepper both sides of the fish fillets. Sprinkle the wondra (or all-purpose flour) on a plate and dredge each fillet in the flour.

title: Reckless Abandon: Pan Seared Snapper with Citrus Saffron Vegetables over Arugula Orzo
summary: Reckless Abandon: Pan Seared Snapper with Citrus Saffron Vegetables over Arugulan Orzo might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 5 and costs $6.59 per serving. Watching your figure? This dairy free and pescatarian recipe has 626 calories, 82g of protein, and 11g of fat per serving. 2 people have made this recipe and would make it again. If you have garlic, orange zest, orzo, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the white wine you could follow this main course with the White Wine Frozen Yogurt as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is excellent. Similar recipes include Reckless Abandon: Seared Ahi Tunan on a Bed of Zucchini Ribbons and Whole Wheat Pasta with Spicy Sauce, Reckless Abandon: Fresh Tuna Tower, and Reckless Abandon: Easy Vegetable Stock from Old Scraps.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Rabble Pinot Gris with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.
